user.title: Set up tinycontrol device
user.description:
Set up your tinycontrol device to integrate with Home Assistant.
To add a device with HTTPS enabled (default port 443), enter the port it uses for HTTP here (default 80).

reconfigure.title: Reconfigure your tinycontrol device
reconfigure.description:
Reconfigure your tinycontrol device after enabling/disabling Basic Authentication or changing network/access settings.
Note that to handle a device with HTTPS enabled (default port 443) enter the port it uses for HTTP here (default 80).

reauth.title: Update your tinycontrol device credentials
reauth.description:
Credentials for the device are no longer valid and need to be updated.
It can occur when the device uses Basic Authentication and its credentials change.

abort.reauth_successful: Successfully updated credentials for your device.
abort.reconfigure_successful: Your device configuration has been successfully updated.
abort.unique_id_mismatch: The device ID does not match the ID in the configuration. It is probably a different device or its MAC has been changed.

add_mqtt_device.name: Add tinycontrol device via MQTT (discovery)
add_mqtt_device.description: Publish MQTT Discovery configs for a tinycontrol device and its entities.

topic_prefix.name: MQTT topic prefix
topic_prefix.description: MQTT prefix set in the device's MQTT client tab.

series.name: Series/entities
series.description: List of series/entity names to create (e.g. var1, var2).

discovery_prefix.name: MQTT Discovery prefix
discovery_prefix.description: Defaults to the MQTT integration setting.
